data.title: C. W. Lindsay Recital Programme [advertisement] Â· Silent Film Music in Canada
data.text:
Description

An advertisement and programme for violinist Rudolph Pelisek's concert at C. W. Lindsay Limited Pianos in 1915

Black and white advertisement. "C.W. Lindsay Limited Pianos 189 Sparks St." logo at bottom. Text reads as follows: Linsay Recital | Saturday Afternoon, January 30th, 1915, At 3.30, | Programme | 1. Victrola - La Favorite (Spirit So Fair). No. 88004. Caruso | 2. Solo - Apollo Player. Romance (Svendseir). Roll No. 400056. | 3. Violin Solo - Selected. Rudolph Pelisek. | 4. Victrola - Stabat Mater (Rossini). No. 88132. Homer. | 5. Solo - Apollo Player. Ballade in A Flat (Chopin). Roll No. 80224. | 6. Victrola - Madame Butterfly (Finale Act 1). Duet, Farrar-caruso No. 89017. | 7. Violin Solo - Selected. Rudolph Pelisek. | 8. Solo - Apollo Player. Valse in E. (Moszkowski). Roll No. 80477. | 9. Victrola - Rose of My Geart (Hermann Lehr). R. Warrenrath. No. 17618 | Rudolph Pelisek - Violinist. | God Save the King.
